messages.content:
The sum of the perimeters of three equal squares is 36 cm. Find the area and perimeter of
of the rectangle that can be made of the squares.

The perimeter of one square is 36 / 3 = 12 cm.
The side of one square is 12 / 4 = 3 cm.
The area of one square is 3 * 3 = 9 cm^2.
The area of the rectangle that can be made of the squares is 3 * 9 = 27 cm^2.
The perimeter of the rectangle is 2 * (3 + 9) = 24 cm.
